intro: Actinophlebia, commonly known as the "spear-leaved plant," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, narrow, and often spiny leaves that resemble spears, giving it its common name. The flowers are typically small and clustered, with showy pink or red petals. Actinophlebia species are native to Australia and are adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. These plants play an important role in their ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various native animals.
